review: It had been a couple years since we visited this particular location and there's a reason for that.  Friday nights are busy and there's a wait to be seated - not a big deal because it's not a long wait.  Our server was Matt - and he was great about keeping our drinks refilled, and my daughter almost always gets a refill on her Mac n Cheese - and that's what Matt seemed to avoid.  In fact, it never happened and he didn't even give her an opportunity to pose the question, though she tried a couple times and he ignored her.  Granted the place was busy, there wasn't an empty table in the place and you could see he was a little stressed by how busy the place was. The food itself here tasted a little off.  Typically I would LOVE clam strips - not this time - they tasted okay but they also tasted like the oil in the fryer needed to be changed.  I think the service and food are better across to Wake Forest way off of Capital Blvd. Noise level here, as with any Red Robin, is LOUD - you can't hear yourself think!
Staff is great!  They need to update the Southwest Chicken Salad to real chicken breast instead of processed chicken.

I hate this entire chain.  It is always noisy, always overcrowded, and more often than not both the food and the service suck. The last THREE times I have been there, I have had to send my entree back: one chicken sandwich doused in so much pesto that the bun was mush, one burger charred so black I actually had to clean soot off of my teeth, and a salad that was about 60% brown, wilted lettuce.  I have friends that like this place for some reason-- they're into the bottomless fries, though the service is always so slow that nobody ever actually gets seconds. Beverages refills are a constant headache, and in my experience are NEVER filled unless you've completely emptied your glass and have asked the server for refills twice.  Also: I know it's "family friendly," but that SHOULD NOT mean that your children are allowed to run screaming through the restaurant. Get a clue, parents.

One of my friends insisted to try out the food here for dinner and the rest of us (4) were too tired & hungry to look for any other place to eat, so we all went in.  This place is trendy just like Friendly up in North East. We started out with "3 for all" appertizer, which has fries, sweet potato & onion ring.  It was good with all different type of dipping.  We ordered veggie burger, prime rib dip, 2 cheeseburgers, & seafood scatter.  The burgers were just average, none of us could finish our burgers.  My seafood plate had shrimps, fish fried & clam strips.  The clam was good, but fish was too oil, shrimp was just ok. Staffs were very friendly & quick. It's a pricey place for the average foods thou.  The pime rib burger was more than $13, and the burger was more than $9 each.  Our bill was $90 for foods & coke !!!! If I'm in the area again, will sure try to eat some where else for money worthy. Oh, a definitely weird thing at this place is they have a little TV in the rest room ????

We have been to this location since it first opened. It used to be fun for our daughters..but now no balloons, only one tv had cartoons on it, changed uniforms, no Red Robin, and increased the bar space. Will not go back..not what it used to be"
Everything about this restaurant is average. The food, service, and atmosphere. Only eaten here twice and both times were just okay.

I've been to this Red Robin location several times, and it's always quite loud! That being said, there's always something on the menu for everyone, from meat eaters to vegetarians. Burgers can be custom ordered, and they offer healthy side options (even steamed broccoli) to the bottomless steak fries (which are yummy!).  Service on this last visit was a bit slow for a group of 6.

Let me just start this by saying that my party and I rolled in at about 9:45. They close at 10. We received the same level of service as if we had come in at 5 in the afternoon. It was great! They have appetizer specials after 8 pm. We saved about 5 bucks. Ordered the hummus, mozzarella sticks, wings, and the fries and onion straws. It came with a bunch of different sauces, but the one that stuck out was the bacon aioli. Most amazing blend of flavors ever! Freckled lemonade kind of fell flat. It was tart with lots of strawberries, but it was missing the sweet aspect. However,  Kudos to Eric for treating us like royalty!

Went back tonight received a letter from Eric assistant manager apologizing about last visit and a gift card tonight we were seated promptly and our server Darnell was great very friendly brought extra napkins without having to he asked burgers were great tried the mushroom and Swiss burger but we did have to ask for a refill on our bottomless fries but wow we each got a small basket overall a great experience thanks
THE place to go if you want horrifically bad service, mediocre food, and an inexplicably long wait.

Went to Red Robin today for lunch with a group of coworkers.  Everyone else ordered burgers and I chose the southwestern salad with grilled chicken.  Waitress was extremely friendly and brought out baskets of fries with sauce for us to munch on while we waited for our food.  Everyone enjoyed The food and I would order my salad again - the ranch dressing was homemade which I am a stickler for.  Waitress even offered us drinks to go which was super nice..  Good service for sure, we will be back.

I come to this Red Robin A LOT and after tonight's visit I will start going to the Wake Forest location. The bathrooms were disgusting. There was urine on 2 of the toilets, toilet paper all over floor, and the trash can was overflowing. Our waitress Brooke was horrible. Basically had to beg for refills and forget about bottomless fries.... then she took forever to bring the bill and even longer to take it. She was too busy talking to her friends or spending time standing in the kitchen. Worst experience ever at this location. **We spoke with the manager Eric and he gave us a gift card and was very apologetic and even took some of the blame**

Very disappointing experience. The burgers took forever to arrive, waitress never checked back to see if we needed water refills or anything. My hamburger was not the too big to hold type that is fun to eat, fresh looking and hot. It was quite low and had a cold onion ring on top. Also when I got my fries they barely filled the little cup they were in and the waitress was no where to be found to get a refill. I will never return. For almost thirty dollars we got two burgers and a beer. Happy Mother's Day to me. We would have been better off going to Hardee's

Food was just so-so and the service was a little worse. My chicken salad didn't contain much chicken and we probably had four or five different people serve our table, none of them seemed coordinated I might add. We had several appetizers that had bottomless chips that took way too long to get refilled and my drink glass remained empty most of the time. I really do not understand how these chain restaurants do so well when the food and service is really just subpar.

UPDATE*** Katie who I guess owns the restaurant, sent me a message on Yelp asking me for my contact info so they could follow up with me and how they could make it right........ I provided my contact information promptly. 6 MONTHS have passed since I wrote this review and never received a call. Went from bad to worse.  Red Robin used to be a place I would go as a young teen for a decent burger and some milkshakes. Walking in with my father the other day, I was horrified at what I was looking at. An overstaffed kitchen and understaffed floor mixed with a hostess who was texting and not once looked at us until I had to talk to her first started what was soon to be one of the worst dining experiences of my life. My dad and I were seated in the back of the restaurants in a group of about 4 occupied tables. A large party had been there previously and the long table was covered with glasses, dishes napkins and garbage, as were three other surrounding tables. The entire time we were there, one of them got cleaned. ONE. Managers walked by it and didn't give it a second glance. After painfully ordering food from the most anti-social waitress in history, we received our food that was lackluster of any flavor other than what I assume cardboard wrapped in bacon tastes like. I was asked if I wanted another lemonade once the entire hour and when I got my refill, it was a diet coke....... After this entire experience, the waitress had the ovaries to ask me to fill out a customer satisfaction survey located in my ticket wallet which I did her the favor of not filling out. Horrible experience and I will NEVER go back to this location. If the managers and employees don't care, neither do i

A substandard burger with service to match.  Several years ago I really loved this place - I swear they had one of the best burgers out there. I probably would have given it 4 stars, but so much has changed.    This evening we went to give them another try, the burgers were not great, and even the other items we ordered off the menu just felt like cheap bar food.  Once seated we managed to get an appetizer ordered (some pretzel bits that were good), and then the server disappeared to the abyss.  Finally after the drinks and the appetizer were distant memories,  we decided to go find a manger who in all sincerity did not seem to know what to do.  Our server arrived (by luck) about 3 mins later and we finally got our order placed.   I appreciate their desire for a modern feel - Something about the design of the restaurant tuns it into an echo chamber.  If there are 50 people in the dining room it sounds like there are 100.  Not entirely surprising as its an open ceiling, hard floors, etc.  The sound simply has nowhere to go.  If you like a loud atmosphere its great, but we've found it difficult to carry a conversation in there.  The food was less than impressive.  At our table I feel like we got a good sampling of the menu - A salad, some wings, burgers, etc. Don't get me wrong, its not all bad.  The good news is the steak fires are bottomless which is great because if you decide you just don't want to finish your entree you can fill up on fries (perhaps that is their design).  We did not get to partake in the bottomless fries as our server was pretty much no where to be found.  I'm not saying the food was not edible, but there are just so many other far superior options for the same price or less.

Amazing service!  Drinks were never dry, very quickly served our foods, and we were a big group! Our waiter was extremely friendly. Additionally, the manager came by several times to ensure everything was ok! Best Red Robin I've been too in the area!
I admittedly haven't eaten here in years, but it's because each of the three times I ate here I got sick, and it wasn't from overeating.

I've been to other RR restaurants that were fairly good.  This one, sadly, was not.  The general look of the place was dull and in need of a good pick-me-up.  There was a general sense of disorganization.  While our server did get our orders correct, she never checked in to see if we needed anything other than what we had. The food was, at best, flavorless.  The burger was cooked beyond well, even though I asked for a medium cook. I suspect a medium cook is not possible as the burgers appeared to be pre-made, packaged, and likely frozen.  The burger lacked even a modicum of flavor. The fries were very ho-hum, lacking anything even approximating crispness. Apparently endless fries means one small serving as that is all I was offered. For less dollars, I could have - and should have - gone to a local burger house and had a good meal. Next time, I'll do that.

First time at this location. We went in on a Wednesday evening and the restaurant was about half full. We asked for a booth and they sat us in the bar.  It was several minutes before anyone acknowledged us. We got our food but the extras we asked for didn't come so we had to wait. We had to wait for silverware and napkins. She refilled Hubby's Dr pepper with root beer. We waited ten more minutes before a different waitress asked if everything was okay. We told her the problem and waited another five minutes for our waitress to bring another soda. And she didn't apologize! I had a burger with bottomless fries and after I was done and put my napkin and knife on my empty plate she asks if I want more fries.  Here's the kicker. Rev Barber/NAACP was also dining two tables away. He came in way after us. He had two servers helping his party of four...I mean all over them.  Thanks for making us feel important Red Robin.

Meh, I have had much better for less pay. I had the back pepper burger and garlic Parmesan fries. I wish I had not. I could not taste the burger because it was burnt and the fries were sub par. I wish I had suggested another place to eat. It was a waste of 60 dollars.

Went here last night.  Party of 12.  Celebrating 2 birthdays and a new baby announcement. Service was underwhelming. Taking the drink order was late, taking the food order was late, food arrival was late and 3 of 12 orders were wrong.  Drinks were always dry.  At one point I got up and walked to the bar to get a refill on my soda. I wouldn't specifically say the waitress was bad.  But I did comment to her that it was obvious the lousy way the short order line was managed as well as the un-hurried attempts at putting the food up. She did comment "you have no idea". The manager made no appologies and was busy at several other tables trying to implement damage control. Several tables around us were very obviously experiencing the same low level of service. It must be a routine issue there, as the management speech I got sounded very rehersed.  We did get comp'd 3 desserts that we didn't order and 1 meal that I finally got after everyone else was done eating. After spending over $90 and the rest of our party well over $120.00 and no real releif, I realized this place has taken a sharp down turn in thier approach to service.  Just looking at the other local area RR reviews, doesn't instill confidence that it's "just this location". All I can advise is, service is a reflection of management.  McDonalds has better service for far less.  Food quality is mutual.  Although RR has a unique spin on the burger experience, the lack of service doesn't equate to good value.  I've written off AppleBee's and Johnny Carrino's in this area.  I don't think my expectations are too high.  I simply think the approach to service has plumetted so low, the management staff is undertrained and the experience just winds up being a blunder.  If you go on the spur of the moment and happen to wind up here on Yelp for a sanity check... your experience may differ.  But I doubt it.

Perhaps it was an off night but it started out with very slow service. A table next to us got their food, ate and were done before we received our food. Once food arrived my order was completely wrong.  And some of us got what looked to be only half an order of fries. Waitress did not check back with us much at all. Called manager, who was apologetic and made sure a corrected order was placed. He then said he would not charge for the order, which arrived once everyone else was about done eating. However, he did charge for the order but only took off a very small amount of the bill.

Let me start with the positives about my experience: We were greeted and seated quickly, probably because the place was 3/4 empty. .....that's it for the positives. Now for the negatives:  Reader's Digest version: Absolutely pathetic, underwhelming, insufficient, unsatisfactory, and inadequate in every phase of service and dining.  Long version : Despite being almost empty the server took 10 minutes to get to the table and get our order. Then brought out the drinks 10 minutes later with the appetizer (wings) we ordered.  (Hint- don't get the wings you'll be really disappointed if you like wings. It looks like they got the leftovers some the small, weak, anorexic chickens) I had to get up and go to a servers station and get napkins myself, because guess what?- the server didn't bring any and disappeared, again. Who doesn't give out napkins for wings? Maybe a cost savings thing. Silverware didn't make it the table the whole night, maybe the dishwasher was on strike or they figured another way to save money by not having any.   Then the entrees come out about 20 minutes later. Meanwhile, drinks have been sitting empty for a while. Manager comes by and asks if everything is ok as food comes out and keeps on walking, never saw him again. I would keep on walking as well if I was in charge of this gastro-fiasco. The burgers are a sad pathetic embarrassment for "gourmet", unless gourmet means "overpriced, small piece of cheap tasteless meat with some toppings on it".  There were probably 10 fries in the basket of fries, but they were in a fancy aluminum cylinder thing. Maybe the artistic fry holder is where the money for napkins and silverware went. Look at the pictures THEY have posted on Yelp. Count the number of fries- it is less than 12 in all the photos.  The edges of the bread was hard, like it was old. A couple of the 10 fries were not fully cooked. I liked Red Robin much better a few years ago when the menu was like Waffle House, a laminated double sided piece of paper and reasonably good burgers. The "gourmet burgers" business model is an EPIC FAIL. Management needs to re-think that concept, starting at this location. Despite her disappearing act most of the night, the server did promptly bring out the bill.  I could go on, but why waste my time and yours? The single star says it all. Bottom line is: go to Wendy's. Get a double. It will be cheaper and more of a "gourmet" burger than this was, you get your own napkins, eating utensils, and refill your own drinks and their service couldn't be any worse!!

I ordered the PRIME RIB DIP and it didn't look anything like what is on the online menu. Very skimpy on the meat. Not wanting to make a scene at the time since it was a birthday party for my 4 year old grandson I sent in a comment via their site and also sent a message on Facebook. They refuse to talk to me. Looking back I should taken a picture of the sandwich and posted it on Facebook. Why is it so hard to want to discuss a problem. You don't lose a customer and you spread the word they care and likely drive more business there way

We stopped in for early dinner on way back to SC. The restaurant was nearly empty and we were seated in a booth next to the bar. As soon as we sat down, we noticed a horrible odor like a sewer back up that seemed to be coming from a drain in the floor of the bar. No doubt the staff had to be aware. Why would you even seat that table? The first food was brought out and we had to ask for silverware and napkins. There were less than 8 tables seated in the entire restaurant yet the wait staff seemed overwhelmed, and  I counted 5 servers on the floor. The food was ok. Very underwhelming experience, I hope their management looks at their yelp reviews once in a while. I was not surprised to discover several similar reviews. Shoulda read them first before going to RR. Funny, nearly all of them said they had to ask for napkins and silverware. Terribly disappointing.
How horrible!  The cook area is unorganized and the food is prefab.  The only positive I can say are the fries are good even though it came after the burger was served.

First off, there are tons of great burger places in that triangle so I don't know why people love red robin. My husband and I went there right before his flight. We were seated right away. From there, the service went downhill. Our waitress left our drinks empty the entire meal. She also avoided us until she put down the bill. The burgers aren't great. The only redeeming quality is the bottomless fries, except the waitress hid from us the entire meal and gave us the bill as we asked for more fries. I don't know if it's just this location or red robin in general. I will not be going back there.

The service here is the pits... The food is typical of all other red robins and have the best fries around. The bacon burger is delicious and big enough to share. All the lemonades are bottomless (as they should be for $4.50 each). He fries/sides are also bottomless which makes sharing even better.  The draft beer options are limited and no locals here.  If the food wasn't delicious this place would get 1/2 a star. Waited over 5 minutes for a water refill. Got the check dropped on us without asking about dessert (which we were going to get) or really being close to finished with our entrees. Our waitress was sitting at a booth eating the whole time...

Great food!! Has the Banzi burger for the first time and had an awesome flavor!! Atmosphere was very casual with a flair of upscale attitude. Our waitress was FANTASTIC!! Always checking on us, great smile and attitude. She recommended great food. Ask for Peyton is you want great service
Ok well the service started off ok but went down from there I had finished me meal and with my trash infront of me they still do not notice I'm ready to go. The food was ok beer cold

I'm surprised at all the bad reviews here. I'm not one to normally write reviews, but I felt this occasion warranted one. We had an excellent dining experience tonight. We had two twin infants, a toddler, and my husband and I. The service was professional, courteous, and prompt. Water was refilled fast, and the manager was out on the floor and asking how our meal was. My husband and I felt almost spoiled- maybe we are used to bad service? Anyways, to top it off- the food was delicious. I love that they have some options under 500 calories. We will definitely be returning.

Thank you to Red Robin for allowing me to pay for my last $10 burger. I will not being doing so any longer - especially at this location. Preface: I love Red Robin's burgers (especially the Royal Red) and I have been to this location in the past. However, after this last visit I felt the need to share my experiences. My party arrived on a slow Monday night at 7pm. Seated right away. Drinks came fast (except for a root beer float) - then absolutely nothing.....crickets.....chirp chirp. Took 45 minutes to get our food - just a few burgers nothing special. Food temp was questionable. Drink refills were nonexistent. Service was the same.  Red Robin no longer serves their messy burgers wrapped up in baskets. Instead they place them unwrapped on fancy plates because they want to compete outside of their specialty with other nicer restaurants. That makes eating such burgers even more complicated and not what I am looking for when I want a greasy burger. Their fries portions are the same size as one would find in a Happy Meal. Forget ordering another round as that will be another half hour wait time - as if they should not expect customers to ask for more of the "bottomless" fries. Not worth the average cost of $15 person. Love the Royal Red but I can add an egg to my burger at home. For eating out, I will stick to the Dollar Menu, Cookout, or Five Guys if I want to splurge a bit. At least I know what I will get from each of these, like them all, and will save some coin along the way.  Miss the old Red Robin.

Very good burger! This was our first visit to a Red Robin and we were very happy with the food. It was very crowded so we had to sit in the bar section which wasn't horrible, but the poor bartender was slammed. We will absolutely go back.

Holy %&#*... what a hot mess. Bottomless fries my ass. Waitress was clearly deaf, she did not care that my drink was empty the 30 times she passed my table, and completely ignored my pleas for more beverage. Just when I was going to get up and go get my own drink she stops and asks would you like another drink.Then it took just as long to get it back to the table. My Wife ordered a mixed drink, one of there supposed signature beverages from the bar. When she got it, it was undrinkable. I mean it tasted horrible. There's no way they would make a drink like that on purpose. We got someone to bring out some pineapple juice to dilute it with and make it less bitter.  She was a trooper and sipped on it. Only because no one cared enough to check back... she had no choice. The food was OK Took forever to get anything. The other thing that pissed me off was that she just came and dropped the plates on the table and said enjoy! She never came back to make sure the food was as expected or even edible for that matter. We asked for fries refill, it never came, we managed to get desert, it was ok as well. The bottomless fries came when we were done with desert...thanks.  Most painful dinning experience ever. Very sad I drove past 5 equally bad restaurants in the 35 mile journey to get here. Now I know, Red Robin can kiss my hairy white butt! Next time I want a burger I'll just save 45 bucks and go to Cook Out.

So my five year old loves this place so we have been to this location many times. Last night we decided to get takeout and we will never go back again.  Let me start by saying the food seemed to be going downhill for awhile but last night was inedible. My husband had some chicken sandwich and had about two bites and threw it out. The only thing I ordered were the steak fries and they forgot those completely. I thought the milkshakes would be ok. I was wrong. The salted caramel tasted like salted milk. Almost got sick after the first sip. Of course my two girls liked their meal but they are 2 and 5.  We don't expect much from Red Robin but we are usually able to eat a meal from there once in awhile. This time I really mean it when I say we will not be going back! Yuck!

I came right before rush hours with some of my fellow co-workers and I will say the service has improved a lot here tho it still wasn't 100% perfect I will say the waiter took his time to make sure the order was right made sure our drinks was filled even sat down with us chatted along and join in our conversation which some people would be upset about but we found it different and he made us laugh. He also asked if we wanted any refills on fries and if we wanted dessert. My only problem was that they didn't have any seafood which put a damper on one of us but the waiter recommended a salad with not only sound good but also when it came to the table it tastes very well so he was the saving grace. I recommend you ask for Angel if you come to the place he will make sure that you are taken very well cared of.

Came in with a small group. Everyone but me ordered burgers, I did not. They forgot to cook my dinner and then lied to me about it despite we are sitting next to the kitchen and heard the yelling match regarding my order. Then  They brought out my dinner and it was burnt to a crisp, and then the guy argued with me about how it was cooked and "in his opinion wasn't burnt and that was just seasoning on it"

I am honestly not a picky critic when it comes to servers or bartenders for I am in the service industry myself. I know that sometimes things happen that the server or bartender can not control. There are also just miserable people out there that are impossible to please.  Tonight was one of the worst experiences I have ever had at a restaurant.  We arrived at 6:45 and stood at the door for about ten minutes before we were greeted by a hostesses. The only reason I knew what time we arrived is because we stood there for so long we checked our phones to see if it was the busy dinner rush and maybe that's why there was no one to greet us. My boyfriend and I were then told it would be a ten minute wait. After waiting 25 minutes our name was finally called.  Upon sitting down we were promptly greeted by our blonde server Briana who took our drink order, then shortly after our food order. We never saw her at our table again after that. It took a good thirty minutes for our food to come out which the manager delivered to our table. Briana never came back to check to see if everything came out alright. My sweet potato fries were super cold. Not even luke warm - seemed like they had been sitting out for a good while. Our ketchup bottle was empty on the table and I was in need of some extra BBQ sauce. We were sitting right next to the food line so we could see our server but she just kept walking right past us. It was probably 7 or 8 minutes I waited until I finally just got up myself and walked to the line to request some ketchup, BBQ sauce, and fresh fries. A DIFFERENT server then came over and brought me everything I needed. The service manager (whose name I can't remember) came over to apologize for the cold fries. He then said Briana was busy helping HIM get food out and that is why she was no where to be found. He wasn't very customer friendly, just seemed more like excuses coming from him. He then tried to make small talk with me as managers usually do to try to take my mind off the frustrations.  We made it half way through our meal (mine was delicious but my boyfriends burger was way over cooked) without ever having Briana come back to our table. She would walk right by; we would see her...but she wouldn't come over. We were soon out of tea. We put both of our empty glasses on the edge of the table and at this point we just stared at her in hopes she would come over. Finally my boyfriend flagged her down and asked if we could have more tea. She then brings over one glass of tea and sits it in front of him next to my empty glass and walks away. We both then laughed because the service was just so terrible it was comical. He then gave me his tea and we waited another ten minutes to ask ANOTHER server for one more glass of tea.  Side note, this entire time we were surrounded by her dirty tables. Every single table next to us was dirty and was never cleaned off the entire time we sat there until we walked out.  No apology from Briana, no emotion was ever shown on her face as she brought over our check. We pre-bussed our own table and neatly laid everything over to the edge of the table. She never came over to take the plates away. We gave her our credit card and watched her drag around the food line aimlessly as if she had no sense of urgency. She brought back our receipts in the check presenter and walks away - and OF COURSE no pen!!!! I honestly just grabbed the closest server and begged for a pen because we wanted to get the heck out of there. The service was honestly terrible. Not only did our service suck but she was waiting on a table nearby and we could hear them complaining to her  about different things she was not doing (ie: wrong cheese on their burger, no refills, etc.)  Me and my boyfriend both being bartenders at a local restaurant we were examining the situation and we came to the conclusion that maybe Briana was in training but had no trainer with her. The credit card receipt that we received back had a different servers name on it (Taylor) leaving us under the impression she was training under Taylor's name.  ****Note to Taylor, I wouldn't trust Briana with making your tips for the night because the service was way less than mediocre.***** You should of been overseeing her.  Honestly, my boyfriend and I agreed to never go back. Which is sad because the food was good enough to go back but the service was just ridiculous.  We did leave a good tip :) we both agreed that it was pretty much impossible to leave a bad tip considering we both work the same job as her and bad tips are the pits. She DESERVED no tip - if I'm being honest. She did absolutely nothing for us but provide a few laughs in regards to the train wreck service she was providing.  Save yourself and choose somewhere else for dinner!!! Or lunch, for that matter.

Everything was great, my party was seated with minimal wait and service was quick and friendly. Food came out fairly quickly and was delicious. They did forget the sauces we asked for but it was swiftly corrected.
Food is bad. Service is bad.  Tried a red robin in Florida and had the same problem. Will not be returning. They just do not care about their customers!

Horrible system for checking in customers. We waited as families who came in long after us arrived got seated before us. They kept telling us it was a 25 minute wait. After being passed over twice we gave up. They knew one family that they put ahead of us. Awful place. I've eaten there before and you have to beg for your drink refill. The only reason I went today was because my husband wanted to go for his birthday.

My fiancée and I came here tonight, and having both served multiple years in the food industry; we were disappointed with some of the things that occurred..... 1.  When the burgers came out there was a strange plastic rock that was served in his basket of fries ! ! !  Our guess is it was once a plastic cap from something in the kitchen & it fell into the deep fryer.....  2.  Although my fries did not have burnt plastic in them, they were not even the right order.  3.  GET THIS:  there was a $1.99 entertainment fee on the (ridiculous) kiosk bill !!!!!!!  WTH is that ???    Other than all that; the food was decent

It's been years since I have been to a Red Robin and I was pleasantly surprised. On each table, they had a touch screen tablet where you can order your food. However, when you first order, you can only use the tablet for appetizers and put in your main course and drinks with your waiter/waitress. If we wanted something from our waitress, then you press the button on the screen and a red light will begin flashing. Our waitress was pretty fast so I was pleased with their service. For food, I ordered short stack order of their famous onion tower because I love onion rings. I made sure to get them extra crispy. Then I got the whiskey river bbq burger with their endless steak fries. I didn't take advantage of the endless fries since I was full with my appetizer, but I thought it was a good deal. The burger itself was a decent size and I liked it. Not the best burger I ever had, but decent. Overall I had great time at Red Robin and wouldn't mind coming back again.

I love Red Robin, have been a frequent customer in both Colorado and Texas. Red Robin in Brier Creek is just flat out terrible. Service is horrific, food is good. Hostesses are mean, servers couldn't  care less, and the management at this restaurant is brutal. Not sure how they stay in business.  I will not go back here. I'm happy to go to Elevation Burger instead. Too bad, nexus I have been a Banzai Burger fan for 10 years or more. Sorry Red Robin, this location is bad bad bad.

Had my first Red Robin experience the other night. Being my first visit I would call It a momentous occasion....Anyways, we sat in the bar area at a High Top and the waitress came by to go over the menu and introduce us to "robin" who was the on-table touchpad device similar to a kindle that allows you to order everything except your main course and even pay for your tab. It's kind of a neat idea since a lot of the drudgery of ordering is easy as pushing buttons on a screen and this simplifies the process. The we ordered a couple apps (chips and dip, onion rings) and they were pretty good. I had a burger for my meal and it was pretty good too. The food overall was....pretty good, but not amazing. The price point for this place seems to be just around 12$ for a burger which is a little steep but you do get bottomless fries with that which is a plus. The only problem I had with this location is that the table and about everything in the area we sat at was kinda sticky like it hadn't been properly cleaned in a while. Maybe it was also the decor setting the mood but the feel was just sort of grimy all over imo. Anyways, if I happen to accidentally wander in here again I wouldn't be upset but I doubt I'll ever seek this place out on my own.

Just left this Red Robin frustrated and hungry.  After waiting for 5 minutes to be seated in a half full restaurant we sat down to order.  We sat down, ordered, our food and after 15 minutes we could see our food sitting in the window and we then waited another 15 minutes for it, but by that time it was cold. When asked to speak to the manager that took another 5 minutes and after speaking to the manager (who did try and apologize and was nice) we left.

So....this has to be the worst red robin experience yet (there have been a few)! Where do I start? First let me say that we both work in the industry so we are overly aware of what is going on when we go out to eat!  First we walked in at 4:10 we waited 5 min to be seated, while there were what appeared to be two managers sitting at the very first table. A server with hands full of plates greeted us and told us she would be right back. She went to the managers at the front table and asked for some help. The manager said she had seen us but thought we had already been helped. We went to the back and as she lead us to the table there was ketchup all over the floor so we reversed to a table we had just passed.  We sat down and waited another 5 min to be greeted by our server. My daughter ordered a Sprite and we ordered a bottled beer and a tall draft. After quite a few min she returned to our table saying she only wanted to bring it all at the same time. She placed the bottle down on the table and then dropped the rest of the drinks on my six year old daughter. Broke the glass in to pieces that landed all in my lap. She looked stunned and didn't get any napkins. I took my daughter to the bathroom to dry off and when I returned he was still waiting for her to come back and clean up. She asked if we wanted to stay at the same table, we moved ourselves. We knew what we wanted because I was looking in the car cause we were on a time restriction. She came back and said she didn't know where the bartender was to replace the beer she had spilt. We gave her our order and then kept on waiting. We wanted to play games because we had already paid at the first table. You can only play once they activated your table. So we know she hadn't put in our food or transferred out table number yet.  Appetizers came out. Small onion tower and clam chowder. Dropped and ran. When she finally came back he pointed out that the soup was to come with bread...she blamed it on the kitchen and then brought the bread 15 min later after he was done with the soup. The manager came to apologize and said he would take care of the beer and the onion rings (but not the soup that was missing the bread). Later he returned with our food. We had ordered a few sauces to try out with our meal. They didn't come out so we let her know and again she blamed it on the kitchen. Brought our sauces out and ran again.  I ordered another beer because my nerves were shot at this point. I would have just drank water, but that requires ever being brought the water. My boyfriend was facing the bar and said it had been sitting there forever. The bar tender brought the beer and didn't ask if she should get another for him since it was completely empty. Server came back to see if everything was ok. But he had to step out he was so frustrated. I asked for the check and a box. About 5 min later she returned to the table with the check but no box. So I asked again. She came back and sorta plopped it on the table. We paid and got out as soon as we could because I had to get home to change my daughter into something that didn't smell like beer to get where we needed to be at 6! No one seemed to be happy to be there. Service was horrible. Food wasn't bad at all so thumbs up to the kitchen. Red robin needs to think of retraining the entire staff. Everyone has bad days or drops something. The key is to genuinely care about your guest and they will be most likely understanding.

Horrible wait service.  Food wrong.  Never got food.  Hell didn't even get straws or silver ware and when asked we were brought back a handful and it was just tossed on the table.  Manger forgot to bring us items.  I hope her tip at that* table full of kids is real good cause I don't think I can even pay for this pathetic meal.
Food was horrible.  Fries were old.  We requested new fries and they took forever to come to the table.  Would never eat at this restaurant again.
Really no stars worst place on earth food is terrible and will get your personal property stolen. DONT eat there!! So much better places. This place is terrible.

I've never been in a restaurant that has such horrible service. The only reason I come back is because the food is always spot on great. If you're on a time table go somewhere else. You could wait up to 10 minutes just to have someone come and get your drink order.  This last time we were taken to our table and had to stand there and wait for someone to come over and clean it. I mean really? That being said 3 stars are for the excellent food.

We took my husband out for his birthday last night having gone there many times in the past;we were totally disappointed.  Service was terrible and food questionable.   We asked our server for things and never received them and finally had to get up and ask the manager.  My son's fries were frozen, cold and not cooked.  3 out of 4 burgers were incorrect with wrong toppings and cooked not the way we ordered.  What made me decide I'm never going back is the table behind us told our server that there was a fly in his child's drink!

Visited around at lunch time around 2 pm when it wasn't too busy. We stood at the front for a couple of minutes but when we weren't acknowledged, we decided to seat ourselves. When the host noticed us at a table, he came over promptly with menus. The server was nice and the food was okay. Another thing that didn't sit well with me was that the manager passed by us several times and did not speak. They could definitely work on their customer service. I'm not too eager to visit again.

waited an hour for 2 burgers, blta and a avocado cobb....we were told oir food was in the window but then the manager came out to say that they had run out of turkey ....table piled up with empty glasses. had to debate if bottomless refills applied to the poppin purple lemonade....after waiting for an hour we got the 2 burgers and the cobb that was grossly missing the avocado and eggs...not blta so my daughter had to wait another 15 mins for a replacement order. nevaaaaa again!!!

Ok Red Robin - I am NOT a fan but my customers wanted Red Robin for lunch and the customer gets to choose!!  We plan accordingly and leave early to arrive before the Friday lunch rush - 1155 we are told 15 minute wait - after 10 minutes we are taken to a table and notice most of the tables are empty - why did we wait??  Well that was only part of the wait because it was ANOTHER 20 minutes before we saw a waitress!!!!  Really??  Friday lunch rush and your location is not prepared?  Just absolutely befuddled!!!!  Fries were cold - burgers had sat somewhere before they made it to us - on it goes!!!  My customer who has a 3 & 6 year old raves about food and service - NOT TODAY!!  A family can wait - business people have schedules and today your organization blew our schedule up!!!  Started with 2stars but as I review before posting moved to a star!!!  TERRIBLE!!!  Absolutely terrible!!

Alright, so the whole "bottomless fries" thing is a joke.  I literally waited 25 minutes for my first refill before the waiter had to go in the back and get it himself (should've been kitchen/bus staff). Our waiter did a great job, he's the only reason I'm giving this place an extra star.  The manager stopped by the table and apologized with the excuse "well we were growing the potatoes", I mean maybe it would've been funny if I had to wait ten minutes, but 25?  For fries?  I work as a waitress, I know it doesn't take long to make fries.  I was ignored, plain and simple, and the manager tries to turn it into a joke?  HM.  Never coming here again.  I felt robbed leaving this place simply because the experience was so awful.  Instead of making a joke next time, miss manager, maybe take an appetizer off the bill.  I would have been a lot less pissed.
I appreciate the management's responsiveness to my feedback.  I'm sure my next visit to Red Robin will go swimingly.

Tried RR tonight. Three years or so since I've been here.  Ordered the Whisky River Chicken.  The chicken was both rubbery and hard to bite into at the same time. I felt like I was in the wild catching my own chickens and chomping on them raw!  Very off putting.  Sliced the chicken in half, horizontally.  Made it tolerable.  Either poor quality chicken or way overcooked.

After several unsavory experiences with the Wake Forest location, we decided to travel out of our way to go to this Brier Creek location instead.  We've been going to these Red Robin locations for several years.  From now on, however, we will not be going to Red Robin ever again.  At both locations, we've experienced less than impressive results. Our final encounter with Red Robin (Sat, 2016 April 2--at this location in Brier Creek) was horrendous:  The waiter was nice but consistently incompetent:  He lost our Rewards card and after leaving us hanging with avoidance tactics, we had to call him over and ask what he was doing about our lost card.  He mumbled something about getting an answer from the manager, disappeared, and eventually the manager showed up with requests for us to look through our belongings.  We had already done so--to a ridiculous extent, as the waiter knew, having gone through that routine with us already.   I informed both the waiter and the manager that after we gave the waiter our rewards card, he went away and came back only with the receipt listing our rewards status.  No card.  He needed to go look for the card.  He disappeared.  We later flagged him down, asking about it, and he mumbled about not being able to find it. Oh, it gets better.  Neither the waiter nor manager made any effort to make our experience any better--other than telling us there was a number we could call.  Even then, we had to tell the manager to actually go ahead and write that number down for us.  It might have been helpful for the manager, instead, to do *anything* proactive--anything from proactively bringing the number to us...to calling the number for us...to discounting the cost of the meal...especially given the consistently incompetent service.   The first sign of trouble was minor enough, and I didn't mind, but most places have a fit when the patron does the waiter's job for him:  I went to the bar to pick up my beer.  It was clear the waiter would not get around to it any time soon, and I was in no mood for waiting patiently to be served a beer gone flat. But wait, there's more:  The waiter demonstrated a complete lack of ability to comprehend my companion's order for a vanilla malt with double the malt.  Someone else came to the table to ask us what we really wanted, beginning with a request for confirmation that we wanted two vanilla malts, which we did not.  She understood the corrected request without difficulty and filled the order quickly.  Long story short, the original waiter failed point after point after point to deliver what we requested, let alone in a timely fashion.  My companion was fit to be tied over losing the card, and the waiter turned into a ghost. This was one of the worst restaurant experiences of my life, and I've had a lifetime of experiences with which to make this comparison.

Came in after 3p, about 3 other patrons in the restaurant.  Get ignored while waiting to be greeted, so I go to the restroom and come out and sit myself at the bar.  (I did want a small table). Sweet Hayley, takes my order, I'm never offered water, I finished my ice cream drink way before the food arrives - just like I told her I would.  (thirsty) I order cornmeal bun, that had to be returned bc it came on regular seeded bun, no big deal - "I think" -  since noticed immediately and the runner said good you haven't touched it, I ordered campfire sauce, that didn't come with the order.  It came when I was down to about 4 fries left.   They delivered the large container of dip, never offered a refill of fries or the first water, but at the same time some of the staff was taking turns sampling the beer.  I said I sure would like some more fries.  She said no problem.  The ball was dropped all over the place in the line of giving 1/2 way decent customer service at a very slow time.  Please improve.

We've been to Red Robin a bunch of times. The food has always been excellent, though they need to learn how to make a root beer float that isn't 90% foam. I really like that they have bottomless fries, healthy alternatives, and beverages beyond soda. I think that's ultimately what draws me to the place. The service has always been excellent, I've never had a complaint about it. The only complaints I do have are price (you can shell out some serious money for a burger here, and some of their apps are grossly overpriced) and cleanliness. They need to put a LOT more effort into keeping the place clean. Every time I'm there, the whole restaurant is littered with napkins, crayons, even menus. The bathroom cleanliness leaves a lot to be desired as well.  Overall, it's a nice, casual place close to us for an impromptu meal when we're too busy to cook.

I think their business model is make the customer wait until they can't wait any more. Order a burger with sweet potatoes fries and they came out with steak fries. It took 15 mins to get the right fries. I ordered another order and that took 20 minutes. came in at 5:45, left at 7:10pm. All we ordered was 3 kids meals and a burger. So disappointed in the service. This place won't last long.
This location does not allow dogs on the patio.  I'm not sure if this is a local policy, but I will not be coming back.

The service here is poor!!  We waited 15 mins before we were even acknowledged by our waiter.  Received appetizer before our drinks.  When our meals did arrive they were incorrect, asked for correction and that took another 20 minutes.  Would have complained to the manager, but he was already getting an earfull from another unhappy customer.

We took my nephew's girlfriend out for dinner for her birthday. Regrettably, we didn't get to celebrate much. We spent the ENTIRE dinner asking for simple things like... Napkins, clean appetizer plates (mine had melted cheese on it), salt, pepper, ketchup, salad dressing for the naked salad -server spilled it), drink refills, again... NAPKINS... again...NAPKINS and to go boxes (for ummm.... the 5th time) and.... how about those NAPKINS to clean up the dressing that you spilled when you delivered the salad? Nope... never got those NAPKINS! The kicker here... we had to track down our server to pay her... UGH! Red Robin... You lost some customers tonight (2ND TIME, similar experience at this location) but we'd like to thank the group that sang HAPPY BIRTHDAY and delivered her an ice cream sundae. .but.... Can't we just get another napkin?

Jesus Christ save this restaurant. This was the biggest mess I've ever seen. Any Red Robin you go to is a total mess. Let's get on with this spawn if Satan already. -- Okay so number one the restaurant wasn't even full it didn't have more then about 6 family's. -- Considering the amount of people in the restaurant you would think that the service would be better but hahahah your wrong. -- It took us 20 minutes just to get our drinks AFTER REMINDING THEM MORE THAN 2 TIMES -- After around 2 hours we finally get our meals. My sister didn't get her meal. When we start eating the food is medium cold. Not hot but not cold. But wait it gets better -- After 20 minutes of waiting for my sisters food the manager I guess came up and told my sister "Sorry we ran out of the materials to make the food...what would you like it's free on the house" -- My sister tells the man that she doesn't know what she wants then tells him to comeback in 5 minutes. -- 5x5=25 "25" is the amount of time it took for him to comeback. Then we waited 30 minutes for the food. -- This is the worst restaurant ever. *I await your food...* ~RebelTaxi

We got a refund from the corporate. They sent us a gift certificate.  And we also got a refund of the meal. From the credit agency. And before we left. The manager told us we are the problems And told us we are rude. And the employees are perfect. And manager would yell at us. In front of other customers. We noticed the male customers and tables. Never got bad service. The same treatment by Hostess/ waitstaff. Talk back rude, repeat the same questions, walk in front of female customers and try to step on their feet, rush to get rid of, yell and interrupt, stand behind and yell in the ear, and try to stick the sharp fingernails into skin of female hands, run away and not volunteer to wait on, walk away in the middle of we are talking to employee. And not volunteer to come back sometimes,repeat the same questions. We had to ask the hostess to wait on us. And threw the menu on the table. The decor is nice. Many good food dishes at moderate prices. We had to ask the waitstaff to wait on us. We saw a waitstaff member walk by table. The waitress not volunteer to write down the menu. Said not want to do it. We told her it is a part of her job. She took our order. It was difficult to give it to her. She not want to stay at our table. And after took the order. Would not come back. We had to ask for a manager. The 2nd waitress came. She demanded to know what we ordered. Told her to ask the last waitress. She gave food and drink. And wanted to know if want anything else we want. We told her 3/4 ice and not order it. And she corrected it. And then left and not come back. Waitstaff no. 3 came . We had to call the manager to come. He not want to spend much time with us. He wanted to be with the table that had his school friends with. We had to ask him to come back and do his job. And got angry at us. Not give us a tip. The hamburgers and salad were average. We called the manager and got a free beverage. We demanded compensation. Many dirty tables and employees not clean it up.The plates are full of food. Fries are very salty.
I love Red Robin. The burgers are great and the fries are endless. Can't go wrong with that.
The burgers here are great!  We have a great waitress too.  I love the bottomless fries!!  Yum yum
Our burgers were phenomenal and the staff was fantastic. My son has a severe peanut allergy, and the staff was very attentive to his needs. Can't wait to go back for a double tavern burger!!!
The service is great, onion rings are tasty, but the burgers were sad
No one should have to wait over 20 minutes on the phone when trying to place a take out order!
This place has awful service. The food is always slow and the service has been awful the past few times we've come here. This will be our last visit to this location.

Woefully understaffed in the kitchen tonight. And the restaurant isn't half full.  Appetizer of pretzel bites came with less than half a ramekin of cheese and we had to ask for more and waited 10 minutes for it to arrive.  Our food took over45 minutes to arrive and again the place is half empty. What's more, the salads did not have the ingredients listed on the menu. We got a bed of lettuce with chicken and our requested dressings.  Waitresses were lined up waiting to pick up food.  Overall a sad experience.  Not to eager to come back. EDITED TO ADD: The manager was kind enough to comp our meal and those of a few others who had the same experience.

My kiddo wanted a burger and I wanted a sit-down restaurant, so Red Robin seemed like a good choice. We were greeted and seated promptly by a friendly hostess, but the rest of the meal was abysmal. Service was terrible. We waited a long time for drinks. Our food was cold when it finally arrived, though luckily my son didn't mind and scarfed down his burger. I ordered a salad and it was gross. The lettuce was wilted and there was way too much onion. Our waiter never checked on us during our meal. After we finished eating we sat for a long time before our waiter finally brought us our check. There are many great burger places in the area and we certainly won't go to Red Robin again.

Red Robin, I was very disappointed! We have gone here before and never had an issue but today we had the worst experience. I don't eat bacon, I asked for no bacon on my burger or on my plate, when our meal came there was bacon on my plate mixed in with my french fries. The manager would have new taken anything off my bill id i wouls not have asked than to add aalt to the wound they to get me to pay for not only the first mistake but my new plate. The waitress never came back to our table we had to call her over to our table and she was very rude when we asked questions about the bill. I can't believe how much we paid for a meal than was wrong than get treated like we did something wrong asking for our meal to be fixed!

The menu pictures paint a very pretty picture of what you think you'll soon be eating. What you're actually served is very different though. The nachos came looking like my 4 and 6 year olds made them. Bottomless root beer floats are half foam. My double tavern burger was missing a hamburger pattie. Our server did the best he could, but he seemed to be stretched thin. The bottomless sweet potato fries were great. The "gourmet" burgers seemed the way to go.

I'm a fan of Red Robbins. This location didn't disappoint. Great burger cooked just like I asked. Great milkshake. Clean restaurant. Friendly staff. They have a large outdoor eating area. Plenty of TVs going. Only issue is a lack of parking.

Now I never write reviews but this is the worst Red Robin I've ever been too. I couldn't find a number to corp so I'll do a review. First, we were seated at a dirty area. Then we waited 10 mins for someone who looked like the manager to take our drink orders. Once he returned he stated someone would be coming to take our orders. Mind you my sister was ready to go but we waited 5 more minutes until we decided to get up and leave. On top if that the guy (the manager) who took our drinks was in the kitchen yelling at the staff. As we were walking out, we were asked did we not find anything on the menu and I said no, no one ever came. Smh terrible, terrible experience.
Not Gourmet anymore turning into high priced Fast Food McDonalds has more class

Arrived at 1:45 pm and was shown to a seat. After 10 minutes I pressed the sever call button on the ziosk. A ref light started flashing and was clearly visible. The table behind me was served lunch yet the waitress never checked in me. After 20 minutes of no one coming by, not even a drink order, I left.

56 minutes to get a hamburger and we still haven't gotten the order for a bowl of soup yet. Sent out this ramekin of soup. Only 4 tables in here. Fries were ice cold. Filled up water in the bathroom sink because waitress was AWOL. Greatest Red Robin disappointment ever. Would give negative stars if it was possible. Still sitting here looking for any sort of leadership. 12/27/2016 now 10pm.

Went on a Saturday night. They were pretty busy and larger parties have to wait, but I got in pretty easily. Their burgers are decent... better than fast food, but not quite as good as real restaurant burgers, but their bottom-less fries with the seasoning is pretty darn good. Drink and dessert selection is not too bad either. Food came out reasonably quick, although it did take them a little while to refill my fries. I pretty much only go to Red Robin because the free birthday burger they give to rewards members. If you sign up for their rewards program, you get a free burger during the month of your birthday, every year. That's a pretty nice perk in my books.

The manager says Emilee is his 2nd most highly rated waitress, I know why, she told us "to give her 10's across the board".  As, she must all whom she serves.  She did not get us to overrate her service.  She was attentive, but not enthusiastic or hospitable, better yet, not even friendly.  Very dry and unwelcoming.  At Red Robin with her, if you order any bottomless items you are a bother.  I was desirous of another refill on both my items but, however, feeling like I would be crossing the line with the request, after the way she asked, would there be anything else young man? and placed her hands on her hip, shifting her foot.  I denied myself gratification at this location.  The manager says she's 2nd best, thats' awful, another server saw my wife needed a to go bag and kindly got up from eating, and gave her a bag.  The 2nd best ignored the need.  Just saying, if you take a job for convenience, it will show, especially if you are front line.  Interviewers, put up your antennas all the way.  These type people may be capable of doing a job, but are certainly not qualified.

If there were a no  star option, it would be chosen.  Absolutely horrible service.  Our assigned server was Peyton and she was not at all concerned about service.  We put on the callserver button after our drinks were delivered and they were wrong. Presuming the call server button is still on! Wrong order--are it as she never returned to see if anything was wrong or right.  No drink refills.
They used to have the billionaire burger. Not anymore  That was the best burger they ever had. The spicy shrimp appetizer is not spicy. It was okay.

Food: 3 Service: 3 Ambience: 3 Date/Time: 4/9/2017 8:15pm Crowd: 1/3 full Order: Whiskey BBQ Chicken Wrap, Turkey Burger Lettuce Wrap I've been to this location several times and it's usually better food and service. This time the hostess seemed annoyed she had to be bothered by us and the server took his time getting to us to get drinks and take the order. However the food came out in a decent time.  The noise level was typical....loud.  The fries were not as good as usual. They were less tasteful even with quite a bit of the seasoned salt on them. The Whiskey BBQ seemed to have too much lettuce and not much chicken. The Turkey Burger was good.  I'd still recommend them when the fries are better. The food is usually pretty good. This must have been an off night.

Ordered a burger and fries through Grubhub.  When the burger was delivered, it was cold and my fries were stale as a rock.  Very poor service.  Not sure whose fault it is.  Called management they pointed to Grubhub, called Grubhub they point to Red Robin.  I'm still without a lunch.  Customers don't matter...
red robin is great I give it five stars because they have corn dogs 6 to 9. The drinks are chocolate milk,hic,lemonade.

My friend and I have visited this Red Robin multiple times over the past year, and their service is consistently horrible. The kitchen often sounds like a brawl is going to break out amongst the staff. Servers here seem unenthusiastic and unresponsive. Tonight, our waitress took our order, then she brought us our drinks. We didn't see her again until we got up to ask for service. We needed drink refills, fry refills, silverware and napkins. I got up to inquire, and a manager got those things addressed. At the end of the meal, the manager didn't offer any assistance. It was time for both my friend and I to receive our 10th burger free. My receipt showed a free burger, but my buddy's didn't. The manager took care of his burger, (and let him keep his free one). When I inquired, he didn't offer the same to me.  I love Red Robin, but this location has very bad management. I've been to the locations in Cary, Wake Forest, and Durham, and they are much better experiences. I do not plan to visit this location again.

Went there after a show this past weekend, and definitely enjoyed myself..Think it was my first time there, and the staff was definitely friendly and the food was very good..Even had some modern style art, including some pop art of which one was a flag made of baseballs....Definitely would recommend the place.......

Visited this location tonight with my children. We were seated in the bar area. Our waitress was the bartender. After our order was taken my son's salad came out first. We had no silverware so I asked the person who brought the food for a set. 10 mins later nothing. Finally I had to go to the bar to ask the bartender for a fork. It took so long because they were all in the dishwasher!?!?!! We then got our food my son having ordered a burger in a basket. When helping him get settled I noticed there was a French fry with ketchup in the basket under his food. The manager did come over and of course confirm how gross this was and thanked me for bringing it to his attention. I was disappointed by the lack of attention from the server. I understand that she may have been busy making drinks so I blame the management expecting a bartender to appropriately attend to guests. I was also surprised to see my son's meal wasn't removed from our bill. Disappointed in both the service and cleanliness of this location. Will never come back!

The most disgusting service I have ever experienced in my life! I ordered through grub hub and paid the outrageous price just to get 3 small tenders (1 Normal size) and not even a handful of fries! After speaking with a manager (not the GM) who sounded genuinely nice over the phone he instructed me to call grub hub only to have grub hub tell me they'll only give me 50% off! I'd rather you take back the good and I'll spend my $12 on a pizza that would st least full me up! I will NEVER dine with you again and I'll be sure to spread the word on how you treat your paying customers. And a little advice to the GM, doing the right thing on a small order such as mine wouldn't have cost you a lifetime of business. I hope what you did tonight was worth the little money you got from me.
Totally generic experience. Burger was good, drink was awful, service was fine but forgettable.

Within 3 weeks span, been here twice, 1st time the waitress didn't ask for drinks for at least of 15 minutes since getting there, finally she brought us two waters that we asked for, ordered food and it was mediocre. During which she never checked on us to see if we needed anything, asked for another round of "bottomless fries" even rang the buzzer off the tablet thing but it took the hostess to get us another order of fries. Couple weeks later decided to give it another chance, burgers tasted charred tasting, waiter was better than the waitress. Won't be coming to this one again.

My husband, dead-tired from 6 weeks in China and ready for an American hamburger, and I  went to Red Robin for the "buy a gourmet burger, get a tavern burger free" deal. Upon finishing his meal, my husband found a worm wandering his plate. The manager said he'd never seen that before. I'm so happy for him. He said it was a little extra protein and said we could have the burger for free. When the bill came, the previously free burger was now $6.99 and the gourmet burger was free. Anyone who wanted our return business would have given the whole meal for free, and thrown in a milkshake. Poor performance, lousy judgment, simple rudeness. I'm telling everyone.

I guess we should have payed attention to the 2 star rating before we dinned in. We had a party of 7, 5 adults and 2 kids. My children received their drinks but had to wait about 10 mins for the waiter to come back with the straws. He had to replace our alcoholic beverages 3 times before we said forget it. The food was VERY mediocre, lets add insult to injury, the waiter just seemed very distracted so much so other staff had to help. I guess he had too many tables but the kicker was the restaurant wasn't busy. My experience was so horrible I will NEVER dine into this horrible establishment again. Hopefully the district manager of this restaurant will see this review and do some training from management on down.

I don't have anything against Red Robin or their food, but the service at this particular location is very poor. After our party of six was seated, no one came to take our drink orders for about 15 minutes. By that time, we were ready to order. Food took an additional 30 minutes to reach the table, and the waiter serving the food forgot which one of the identical burgers that me and my friend ordered was cooked medium and which was cooked medium-rare, so he just guessed. The waitress who initially took our orders was barely present throughout the experience. Theoretically, fries are bottomless at Red Robin, but service was so slow that we only received one refill. Our waters we also only refilled once throughout the meal. Overall, the flavor of the food really wasn't bad, but the lackluster service took away from the experience. I'd most likely avoid this location in the future.

The Banzai burger is still the best!  I've been eating at Red Robins for over 30 years.  The food at this location is excellent, the staff is friendly, and I've never had any issues with their service.  My wife is a vegetarian and very happy with their selections - she even has her own RR Royalty card.  YUMMMM!!

Red Robin is choking!!! I believe Red Robin is not as good as what it used to be. Here's why...service is okay, not overly friendly, especially for the price of their food. I get it, a little, as a former server of a burger joint. The cup of soup that cost $5 and was extremely small and took (13 literal bites) is hardly what I would expect to pay. The size of the cup was laughable and a bit appalling. Burgers are always good, but the "all you can eat fries" is not enough to keep me going here. I'm sitting at the bar and a carryout order came in to place an order and waited ten minutes and still no one came, so she decided to go elsewhere. The bartender did tell her that someone would be there to take the order, but no one came. It's a bit of a shame and I can't say I will be back. I feel for $11 a burger, I can go someplace happier, with better and fast service than this place. I've currently waited over thirty minutes for a burger . Red Robin, I won't be back...you're cooked!!!
Amazing burgers and fries. The food is always fresh, hot and served with a smile. The only downside is because they are so good, there can be a wait, even during the week and it is very loud.

To management - hire pleasant employees for your hosting area and actually have servers come by tables of PAYING CUSTOMERS.  I know, it's s crazy idea but your customers won't walk out IF a server actually comes by the tables!  We were rather rudely greeted at your location by a not very friendly hostess, waited at a two top booth for 10 minutes for a server.  Any server.  None showed.  We got up and left.  Mentioned to your surly hostess on way out that we were never approached by a server.   Heads up - you lost out on a $40 lunch tab.  And, your reviews on Yelp are awful.  Might want to reassess what y'all are you doing wrong.  We will never visit your location again.

No complaints, my visit was during peak hours so we had about a 15 minute wait. Nothing to complain about, good service and in a timely manner. Would give 5 stars but that's for the restaurants that make give you exceptional service. Overall solid place to eat

Red Robin is our sit down burger place. I have been to this location a handful of times and I keep thinking management will be better. As always there is no hostess to greet you. Tonight there were 3 families waiting and complaining. The bartender alerted a waitress who looked less than pleased to also be a hostess. We were seated and waited a few minutes until a waiter showed up.  The restaurant was definitely understaffed, waited a while for the app and food. We ordered chicken wings as an appetizer but turned out the ran out. We ate, got our check and realized bill was as wrong. The beer was listed as 3.50 and we were charged 6.50. Took a while for the waiter to show and fix problem. I think having the touch screen system makes it hard to locate the waiter and service sucks. We had to ask another waitress for our waiter in order to get refills too.

Similar experience from other Yelpers, no hostess to greet us when we came in.  A server happened to walk by and seat us - turned out to be our server.  We have been coming to this location for about 9 years and things are really starting to decline.  I used to think a lot of reviews were unfair for this place - you have to temper your expectations a bit with all the crazy screaming kids.  But server attentiveness has declined (Not sure if it is the table tablet computers our not) and the cleanliness of the location has plummeted.  The baby changing station in the women's bathroom needs dire need of a wipedown and cleaning. But why a three?  The food is still decent and that has not wavered.  I do ask management to be more reasonable in how they staff and to focus more on customer experience to push this location back up to a four where it should be and stay.

This is my first time writing a yelp review, but my experience at Red Robin made me feel as if I needed to. We walked in and were seated fairly quickly, but no one had come to greet us or get our drink order for about 10 to 15 minutes. We brushed it off when the waiter finally came over because he apologized and thanked us for our patience. We immediately asked for a drink and bottomless fries. He went to put that order in and came back to take our dinner order. About 25 to 30 minutes pass by and we still had not received our fries. We politely asked the waiter if we could get those fries and he said that the kitchen was running behind. He came back a few minutes later with the smallest plate with maybe 7 fries on it. Our food came out shortly after which was mediocre, if even.  The first thing we noticed when we walked in to Red Robin was the dessert trio that was advertised all over, which consisted of an oreo sundae, chocolate covered brownie sticks, and donuts. We never order dessert, but it looked so good that we had to get it. Another 15 to 20 minutes pass by before we actually got our dessert. A lady brought it out and it had the tiniest donuts, the brownie sticks, and a bowl of crushed up oreos. I told the lady that we were supposed to have the trio with the ice cream sundae, so she took it back. She came back out with the exact same bowl of crushed up oreos, but with soft serve ice cream sloppily poured on top. Still no toppings on it. Literally just ice cream and crushed oreos, no hot fudge, whip cream or cherry. It looked absolutely NOTHING like the picture. McDonald's provides a much better sundae and it looks 100 times better than what we were given. We asked to speak to the manager, who didn't seem very sympathetic, but took the dessert off of our tab. We told him we didn't want the dessert and just wanted the check. I normally don't get offended easily, but the experience was degrading in the way they served the food like we wouldn't notice. We will NOT be going back to any Red Robin after this experience.

Well the hostess was completely disappointed to have to seat a party of three. That probably upset her snap chat session. Well we got seated at 2:30 on a Sunday afternoon. The restaurant was just dirty!!!!!! Pointed this out to a employee and her response was it's not my job. I was taught that if a business fails so does your need for employment.  But let's face it, they don't care. Good luck with that. My experience in the last year with franchise restaurants has been horrible. It will only be a matter of time. I left my phone in the car, because I feel it's rude to talk while in a business. So no pics of the unkept store. We got my child's order and told the waiter we were leaving and we needed the check due to the filth an attitude of the other employees.

If nothing else, Red Robin is consistent.  Consistently slow. Consistently giving horrible service. Consistently failing to give the customer a great experience.  I have not idea who the manager is or how this place is even still in business.  They. Don't. Care.
The bartenders are always so nice and helpful. Food is always on point and you get free refills of fries!! Yummm! Keep up the good work RR team at Brier Creek!
Not my favorite place but my boyfriend loves it. Horrible service. It's like we kept getting forgotten about and we stood at the front waiting for someone to seat us for ten minutes.

I ordered from here tonight with an ordering service.  When my order arrived I realized that my chili cheese fries were just regular fries, that I had just a drop of cheese sauce for my pretzel bites and no sauce for my other appetizer.  When I called in to complain, the woman that answered accused me if lying stating that she put in certain sauces herself and she saw her manager put in lots here.  I told her the sauces are not here.  So she asked if I was going to come in and pick up the extra sauce.  I told her that totally defeats the purpose of ordering delivery.  She then directed me to call the ordering service and did not try to help me further! I will not return to this location.

Been here plenty of times but service is really spotty. Tonight they " lost" our order , told us that after we were waiting 30 minutes and then it took another 25 minutes to get food out. Food was lukewarm, didnt want to send back cause who knows how much longer it would take . When we are finally served the waitress didnt even apologize for the wait. Others around us who came in later were served earlier. We hadnt been here for awhile and there are plenty of other choices in the area. Probably wont be back after this experience.

I absolutely love Red Robin. I'm not just giving 4 stars because I love the restaurant. This location is a very nice one! I absolutely love the decor! It's awesome! This location is huge! It has a lot of seating! On weekends during dinner time, there's a bit of a wait, (expected), but there's never a hostess to greet you.. but other than that, it's fine. Their burgers are to die for. Very great staff as well. Will be returning :)
